Recipe.title: Queso Hondo
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of a random friend at a party
Recipe.Description:
We have purchased all sorts of dips, such as nacho cheese, for corn chips, but nothing really had that wow we wanted. Then, at a party, we tried a dip that really impressed us. We asked around and found out it was "homemade" and we coaxed the recipe out of them.
First, you need to know that in Spanish, the letter "i" is pronounced "ee". While eating in a Mexican restaurant, Ransom and Jennie were served a tasty cheese dip. Ransom learned Spanish on his mission, but didn't know the word for "dip", so, in Spanish, he asked the waiter who replied "hondo". Ransom thought that a little odd, but later realized that when he said "dip" he said it with a Spanish accent, so the waiter thought he said "deep". The word for "cheese" is "queso" (pronounced "KAY-so"), so ever since, we have called this dish Queso Hondo.

section.instruction: Cut Cheese Spread into, ½-inch cubes
Heat the Cheese in the microwave oven for 30 seconds.
Repeat steps 2 and 3 until the Cheese is melted.
Heat in microwave oven for 30 seconds.
Repeat steps 6 and 7 until mixture is smooth.

Notes.note: Do not use Plain Cheese, such as Cheddar. It turns into a glob instead of a spread.
Do not use Nacho Cheese. It turns into a soup instead of a spread.
Chunky salsa is usually more appealing.
You can use Mild, Medium, or Hot Salsa, depending on your preference.
